revised_title: Electrogenic Chloride Transport in Locust Rectum
tldr: The authors investigate the binding and transport of anions in living tissues, specifically focusing on electrogenic chloride transport in locust hindgut. They discover that this transport process is different from mechanisms proposed for vertebrate tissues and is regulated by a neuropeptide hormone. The study provides insights into the unique mechanisms of potassium chloride reabsorption in insect epithelia.
